revised_title: The Discovery of Uric Acid in the Green Gland of Astacus fluviatilis and Atomic Weight of Glucinum
tldr: The authors investigated the green gland of Astacus fluviatilis and discovered that it contains uric acid and traces of the base guanin, suggesting that it functions as a urinary organ. Additionally, they determined the atomic weight of glucinum (beryllium) and found that it belongs to the same class as carbon, boron, and silicon.
scientific_discipline: Chemistry > Atomic weight and chemical compounds
